eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Anti-Gravity Society
eventData.description:
The Yale Anti-Gravity Society aims to bring together jugglers and people with other circus-related talents of all skill levels so that we may learn from one another and grow as entertainers and performers. Juggling along with other circus arts is intrinsically a group activity, and we aim to create a supportive space where anyone with any interest in such activities can share their passion with other like-minded individuals and possibly collaborate on performances.

Come hang out with YAGS and learn about the wonders of juggling at Yale!

eventType.name: Academic Departments & Programs
eventType.description: Get to know more about some academic departments & programs at Yale through these live events.

eventData.headline: Chemistry Department Welcome
eventData.description:
Chemistry's peer mentors, DUS and department welcomes the incoming class of 2025 through live Zoom event this Friday, April 30th from 3-4 pm. Peer mentors will go through some common topics and frequently asked questions.This is a great opportunity to hear from current undergraduates about their experiences' and ask some questions about the chemistry program at Yale.

Please join us at this Zoom link: Join from PC, Mac, Linux, iOS or Android: https://yale.zoom.us/j/96367103593?pwd=OVVvTHdBU2ZUemZsVllYMGE4eWhUdz09    Password: 833374    
Or Telephone:203-432-9666 (2-ZOOM if on-campus) or 646 568 7788    
Meeting ID: 963 6710 3593    
International numbers available: https://yale.zoom.us/u/abu9QZCriv 
Password: 833374

Note that you will be admitted by a host into the meeting.
Questions or would like to let us know of your attendance, email chemistry.dus@yale.edu

Thank you!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Code Haven
eventData.description:
Code Haven is an undergraduate student organization at Yale University dedicated to introducing young students to computer science! Every week, Code Haven mentors teach computing lessons at several schools in the New Haven district, engaging the students with online lessons, group activities, and class-wide demonstrations. Mentors are Yale undergrads who hail from a variety of backgrounds and possess myriad academic and extracurricular interests, but they all share a passion for making education more readily accessible and inclusive!

Code Haven will be hosting an informational session on April 16th and April 30th! Prospective Yalies will get a chance to hear from current mentors and board members about the Code Haven experience, outreach and volunteering opportunities in New Haven, CS at Yale, and more! Most importantly, the info session will serve as a chance for prefrosh to meet current Yale students in a casual setting. Everyone, regardless of their experience in CS, is welcome to attend!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Precision Marching Band
eventData.description:
The YPMB is Yale's premier "marching" band, and we invite all students (and even faculty) to join us!  

Do you play an instrument? Great! Show off your skills while playing alongside YPMB members who are also in other groups, like the Yale Concert Band and the Symphony Orchestra. Always wanted to learn how to play one? Awesome! We can hook you up with an instrument and a teacher. Love appreciating music, but not playing it? Incredible! All of our music is student arranged (that's right-we get to play all the pop, rock, hip-hop, etc. music we want!)! Love the vibe of the band, but looking for a virtual art outlet? Join the Squids, who put together all of our props for halftime shows (re: our 40ft bald eagle prop). Got a good sense of humor? Help write and put together our halftime shows-every member of the band has input!

We could go on for pages trying to tell you what we are. You’d be best off to show up and find out, really. You won’t be disappointed!

YPMB Open-Rehearsal!
Join the Members Of... for our regular Friday rehearsal! We’ll be sharing videos highlighting the fun stuff we’ve done in the last couple of years, introducing officers, playing music together, and having section (intrument) based meet & greets in breakout rooms!

[This event is BYOI (bring your own instrument) if you’d like to have one, due to our inability to magically teleport an instrument to your home. But remember, this is the YPMB-anything and everything can be an instrument!]

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale International Relations Association
eventData.description:
The Yale International Relations Association (YIRA) is the largest undergraduate organization on Yale's campus. If you're interested in anything from traveling the world to speaking at the UN, from designing websites to teaching high-schoolers, or from model UN to writing about global affairs, then YIRA has a home for you!

Game Night with YIRA:
Join us for a fun, casual night of virtual games—we'll be playing GeoGuessr, Among Us, Skribbl.io, JackBox, and more! Stay for as long or as short as you’d like!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Red Hot Poker
eventData.description:
Red Hot Poker is Yale's funniest and hottest sketch comedy group. We meet twice a week for a "writers room," where we pitch and workshop our sketches. And we put on several well-attended shows a semester! We hold an annual audition in September.

Come see comedic sketches and talk with the group!

eventData.headline: Yale Daily News
eventData.description:
The Yale Daily News is an independent student newspaper published by students! It is the oldest college daily newspaper in the United States. Learn more about getting involved with the YDN on campus through this event.

https://yale.zoom.us/j/9980979097

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Taps at Yale
eventData.description:
Taps at Yale, Yale's best and only all-tap dance student organization, was founded in 1995. A professional-level company, Taps is a dynamic group dedicated to performing and spreading our love of tap dancing. Every year, Taps produces two student-choreographed performances, showcasing the incredible range of styles within the art form. Dance abilities range from "I haven't tapped since I was 4" to "I played Billy Elliot on Broadway.” All are welcome to audition. Please visit https://tapsatyale.wixsite.com/yale for more information.

Come to Taps at Yale's info session! Meet current members of Taps, ask questions, and watch videos of past Taps performances.

eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: The Yale Undergraduate Math Society
eventData.description:
The Yale Undergraduate Math Society is excited to welcome prospective students to one of its Pizza(-less) Seminars! We generally host these seminars once every week or two and invite speakers to give a talk about anything math-related that they want. This week, our very own Professor Cosmin Pohoata will be giving a talk! Afterwards, we plan to hold a social hour where we'll talk about the Yale undergraduate math community and cats. Come by for a fun math and cat-filled evening! (P.S. bring your favorite circular food!) The specific time the YUMS event will run on Friday is from 5-6 for the speaker and 6-7 for the social hour.

https://yale.zoom.us/j/93022685686

eventData.headline: Global Affairs
eventData.description:
Learn more about the Global Affairs major at this event! There will be a short introduction followed by Q&A.

The Global Affairs major is designed to give students the social science research tools to solve today’s most pressing global challenges. It is a truly interdisciplinary program with courses in nearly all departments at Yale. The major includes about 60 students per class selected by competitive admissions.

https://yale.zoom.us/j/3443645121
